medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced recurrent primary hyperparathyroidism (PHPT) after the removal of five parathyroid glands. Serum calcium and intact PTH levels gradually increased after 7 years post-operation, suggesting PHPT recurrence. At age 42, her serum calcium was 10.8 mg/dl and intact PTH was 105.2 pg/ml. A polyp was found incidentally during upper gastrointestinal endoscopy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: At age 34, the patient was diagnosed with multiple endocrine neoplasia type 1 which led to PHPT, non-functioning pituitary, and pancreatic neuroendocrine tumors. She has undergone multiple parathyroidectomies due to parathyroid hyperplasia.
medical_history.family_history: The patient has a family history of primary hyperparathyroidism (brother).
